blocks.name: OPTIONS
blocks.description: Options controlling general head boundary package behavior and output.

variables.name: AUXILIARY
variables.description: Defines auxiliary variable names to be associated with each GHB entry.
variables.tooltip: One or more names of auxiliary variables read with each GHB entry. Can be used for transport concentrations or user-defined data.

variables.name: AUXMULTNAME
variables.description: Name of the auxiliary variable to be used as a multiplier for the conductance.
variables.tooltip: The named auxiliary variable is multiplied by COND to compute the actual boundary conductance.

variables.name: BOUNDNAMES
variables.description: Keyword to activate reading of boundary names for each GHB cell.
variables.tooltip: When specified, each GHB entry can include an optional text name for grouping in budget reporting and observations.

variables.name: PRINT_INPUT
variables.description: Keyword to print GHB input data to the listing file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, GHB data read for each stress period is echoed to the listing file.

variables.name: PRINT_FLOWS
variables.description: Keyword to print GHB flow rates to the listing file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, computed GHB flow rates are printed to the listing file for each time step.

variables.name: SAVE_FLOWS
variables.description: Keyword to save GHB flow terms to the cell-by-cell budget file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, GHB flow terms are written to the binary budget file for post-processing.

blocks.name: PERIOD
blocks.description: Stress period data specifying general head boundary locations, heads, and conductances.

variables.name: CELLID
variables.description: Cell identifier for the GHB location (layer, row, column for DIS; layer, cell2d for DISV; node for DISU).
variables.tooltip: Identifies the model cell where the general head boundary is applied. Flow is proportional to the difference between the boundary head and the cell head.

variables.name: BHEAD
variables.description: Boundary head for the GHB cell, in model length units.
variables.tooltip: The head at the external boundary source/sink. Flow into or out of the cell is computed as COND * (BHEAD - cell_head). Can represent distant water bodies, regional aquifer heads, or other external boundaries.

variables.name: COND
variables.description: Hydraulic conductance of the GHB connection, in units of length squared per time.
variables.tooltip: Controls the rate of flow between the boundary and the cell. Higher conductance means more flow for a given head difference. Computed as K * A / L where K is hydraulic conductivity, A is cross-sectional area, and L is flow path length.
